raw_response: {"answer_index": 1, "answer_text": "Urinalysis", "confidence": 10, "reasoning": "This patient suffered a high-voltage electrical injury with a burn on the right arm and severe bilateral flank pain. Electrical injuries can cause rhabdomyolysis due to muscle breakdown, which releases myoglobin that can damage the kidneys. Flank pain is a classic symptom of rhabdomyolysis-induced myoglobinuria. Urinalysis is the first diagnostic test to evaluate for myoglobinuria and assess kidney involvement. Other options (FAST, X-ray, EEG) are less immediately relevant to the most life-threatening complication in this context."}
